segments.text: How many people are there in your family ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There are 15 people in my family .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What did you say ? How many ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wow . That is a very big family . Do you all live together ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Of course we do ! My father's parents , Mum , Dad , three unmarried aunts , two uncles , my two brothers , my three sisters and me .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But you don't live at home anymore .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Right , but that's where my heart is . But you're right , now there are only 14 living at home .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My goodness ! Your family must live in a huge house .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . My family lives in rural Korea , near Pusan . We have a huge house.The first floor of the house is a part-time private school.In the afternoon , students come for special tutoring in biology , Englis
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Wow ! you grew up in a school ! No wonder your English is excellent !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My aunts and uncles are all teachers .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I guess so . While growing up , I read hundreds of interesting English storybooks every year .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's what i did in America . I was reading all the time . I was never a big TV watcher . TV wastes time .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I agree . Reading for fun is why all the English students at our family school have excellent English . All the students read 800 easy storybooks during their second year of studying English .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My aunts studied in the American universities.They say that extensive reading for fun is the most effective way to improve your English.That ' s what they learn here in America .
segments.speaker: S2
